chapter.title: Document Manager
chapter.para: Documentation is probably the second most important deliverable in a software project after the software work products themselves. CodeX provides a specific service to manage your project documents.
The CodeX Document Manager is very basic and cannot compare in any way with specialized document repository like DocuShare. The Document Manager features are a follows:

listitem.para: Only text and HTML documents are properly handled
Documents are stored in groups (or folders). The folders are only one level deep which means you can't have subfolders in a folder
Documents can be edited on line.

It is based on a Submit-Publish model where anybody can submit a new piece of documentation and it is up to the project team to decide if they want it to appear in the document collection or not (publishing)

chapter.para: The intent of the Document Manager is to give a quick and easy access to the essential documents of a project, those which are really useful to the developers community or the users if the software is intended for end users. Typical examples are: User Guide, Administration Guide, API References... HTML is the format of choice because it is a standard format and it does not require any specific software to be read.

section.title: Document Browsing
section.para: To access the Document Manager select the "Docs" item from the Project Menu at the top of the screen of the Project Summary page. The welcome page of the Document Manager shows the list of all the documents published by the project by group.
To read a document simply click on the title.

section.title: Document Submission

para.note: Before the first document is submitted to a project, the project members with "Editors" rights on the Document Manager must first create one document group (folder). A document has to be attached to a group in any case hence the need for at least one document group.

section.para: Following the CodeX philosophy, any CodeX user can submit a document to a project team. To submit a new document, click on the "Submit New Documentation" link in the Document Manager menu (). Then provide the Document Title, the document description and the body of the text.

The document itself can either be copy-pasted directly in the document text area or uploaded with the help of the "Browse" button and the "Upload" checkbox. Then select a document group from the pull-down menu and click on the "Submit Information" button.

tip.title: Tip: Referencing non HMTL documents
tip.para: As said earlier, the CodeX Document Manager only supports text and HTML documents. However, you can also create placeholder documents that point to another location where you have stored other documents like a DocuShare collection or a DocuShare file for instance. To do this, simply surround the document title with an HREF tag (hyperlink) pointing to the real location elsewhere on the Xerox Intranet (an example is given with Document #15 in )

section.para: The document title and summary can contain HTML tags. So you can use all sorts of typographic effects as well as pointers to other locations, etc.

section.title: Document Administration
section.para: The Document Manager provides a number of administration functions like validating the publication of a document, changing a document status or group, creating new document groups, etc.

section.title: Document Publication
section.para: Once a new document has been submitted it must be validated before publication. In other words it won't be visible on the Document Manager welcome page until a project member who has "Editor" rights on the Document Manager has blessed it.

To validate the publication of a document click on the "Admin" link in the Document Manager menu (). What you see next is a list of all documents submitted to the project sorted by status. The documents with status "Pending" are listed at the top of the page. These documents have been submitted and are awaiting the project member review and blessing to become public.

To validate a document, click on the document title. Go at the bottom of the next screen and change the Document status from Pending to Active. Click on the "Submit Edit" button to validate the changes.

section.title: Document Update
section.para: You can update a document in several ways:

listitem.para: The title, description and document body can be modified. In this case you update the document content
You can change the group (or folder) a document belong to
You can change the document status

section.para: To update a document click on the "Admin" link in the Document Manager menu () and then the "Edit Documents" item in the next menu. Then choose the document you want to update from the list. Click on the document title to make the document update screen appear. From here you can modify any part of the document, the group it belongs to or its status. The document status can take one of the following value:

listitem.para: Active: the document is visible on the Document Manager welcome screen and can be read by any CodeX user.
Deleted: the document has been marked as deleted by the project team. However it is not physically deleted from the Document Manager and it can be undeleted.
Pending: the document is temporarily hidden form the public view of the Document Manager
Hidden: the document is temporarily hidden form the public view of the Document Manager
Private: the document is only visible to the project members not to external CodeX users.

section.title: Document Group Management
section.para: To create, delete or change the name of document groups, click on the "Admin" link in the Document Manager menu () and then the "Edit Document Groups" item in the next menu.

To add a new group, use the "New Group Name" text field at the top of the screen and click on the "Add" button. You can also delete or rename an existing group by clicking on the appropriate link in the group list.

tip.title: Tip: Document Groups ordering
tip.para: By default the Document Groups are listed by alphabetical order on the Document Manager welcome page. If you want to impose your own order modify the group names by adding a number at the head of the document group (e.g. 1-, 2-, 3-...) . The groups will then be presented on the screen in the same order as the prefix numbers.
